Text: OMG - "The image required 800 exposures taken over the course of 400 Hubble orbits around Earth. The total amount of exposure time was 11.3 days, taken between Sept. 24, 2003 and Jan. 16, 2004."

"If you could take this image and wrap it around the earth, you would see a smaller portion of this (roughly half) if you looked up at the night sky and there was no atmosphere to block your view."

You have somehow managed to get this completely wrong.  It's an image of a piece of the sky roughly 1/10th of the diameter of the moon as seen from earth.  Details here:  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultra_Deep_Field

Also, a still larger TIFF is available that has the complete data from the entire survey in one image here:  http://www.spacetelescope.org/images/html/opo0428b.html
